q: MUSIC mogul Simon Cowell has confessed he learnt nothing at school. Instead he taught himself and relied on "instincts" to amass a? 165million fortune. He said: I never really had a proper education. I wasn't born with any skill. I didn't learn anything from school. "Mainly, I trust my instincts because I have very broad tastes. "I believe if I like something, other people are going to like it as well. Have your say on the issues of the day with MY Sun? News Group Newspapers Ltd. the biggest school-building programme since Victorian times. Its plan, announced by Tony Blair in 2004, was to rebuild or refurbish every secondary school in England. But Michael Gove told MPs in July that BSF had been beset by massive overspends, tragic delays, botched construction projects and needless bureaucracy . He has also said he believes there is little evidence that new school buildings improve standards. The word is that the American executives behind the launch of Simon Cowell 's X Factor US are not convinced that Cole is well enough known among the show's potential core audience. It was thought the American job was a done deal but it seems the US executives have had a last-minute change of heart. They are now questioning whether she's famous enough in America. Kirsten Gillibrand said the findings only heighten her worry that Megrahi's release undermines the international struggle against terrorism.
